what: Calculate intersection metrics in tracks — track_intersection
title: Calculate intersection metrics in tracks — track_intersection
text: track_intersection() calculates number unique intersections trajectories. function also supports testing simulations different permutation procedures coordinates simulated trajectories' origins compute p-values. allows robust assessment intersection metrics, enabling users evaluate significance observed intersections relation simulated trajectories.

title: Calculate intersection metrics in tracks — track_intersection
code: track_intersection(   data,   test = NULL,   H1 = NULL,   sim = NULL,   origin.permutation = NULL,   custom.coord = NULL )

title: Calculate intersection metrics in tracks — track_intersection
text: data 'track' R object, list consisting two elements: Trajectories: list interpolated trajectories, trajectory series midpoints consecutive footprints. Footprints: list data frames containing footprint coordinates, metadata (e.g., image reference, ID), marker indicating whether footprint actual inferred. test Logical; TRUE, function compares observed intersection metrics . Default FALSE. H1 character string specifying alternative hypothesis tested. Options "Lower" testing whether observed intersections significantly lower simulated ones (e.g., coordinated gregarious movement), "Higher" testing whether observed intersections significantly higher simulated ones (e.g., predatory chasing events). sim 'track simulation' R object consisting list simulated trajectories use comparison test = TRUE. origin.permutation character string specifying method permutation coordinates simulated trajectories' origins. Options include "None", "Min.Box", "Conv.Hull", "Custom". Default "None". custom.coord matrix custom coordinates define vertices area permutation coordinates simulated trajectories' origins.

title: Calculate intersection metrics in tracks — track_intersection
text: 'track intersection' R object consisting list containing following elements: Intersection_metric matrix unique intersection counts trajectories. entry represents number unique intersection points corresponding pair trajectories. Intersection_metric_p_values (test = TRUE) matrix p-values associated intersection metrics, calculated permutations simulated trajectory origins. entry reflects probability observing intersection count extreme observed one, given null hypothesis difference. Intersection_metric_p_values_combined (test = TRUE) numeric value representing combined p-value intersections, indicating overall significance intersection metrics across pairs trajectories. Intersection_metric_simulations (test = TRUE) list containing matrices intersection counts simulation iteration, allowing inspection distribution intersections across multiple randomized scenarios.

title: Calculate intersection metrics in tracks — track_intersection
text: track_intersection() function designed calculate number unique intersections trajectories evaluate statistical significance hypothesis testing based simulated tracks. process provides robust framework comparing observed intersections expected random conditions, allowing users test specific behavioral hypotheses related movement patterns trackmakers. Hypothesis testing controlled H1 argument, defines alternative hypothesis evaluated. argument crucial interpreting statistical results, determines whether function test reduced increased intersection counts compared simulated trajectories. H1 argument accepts two possible values: "Lower": option tests whether observed intersections significantly lower generated simulations. scenario corresponds hypotheses involving coordinated gregarious movement, animals moving parallel group (e.g., hunting packs social gatherings) produce fewer intersections expected random conditions. "Higher": option tests whether observed intersections significantly higher generated simulations. applies scenarios predatory chasing interactions likely, one trackmaker follows crosses path another. behavior results intersections occur randomly. selection H1 argument must consistent behavioral hypothesis tested. example, use "Lower" investigating group movement cooperative behavior, "Higher" analyzing predatory competitive interactions. function automatically adjust calculation p-values reflect selected H1. argument left NULL, error triggered, indicating users must explicitly specify hypothesis tested. interpretation combined p-value returned function directly influenced choice H1, determines whether statistical comparison aims detect reduction increase intersection counts compared simulated dataset. addition hypothesis testing, track_intersection() function offers several options altering initial positions simulated tracks origin.permutation argument. available options include: "None": Simulated trajectories shifted compared based original starting positions. "Min.Box": Trajectories randomly placed within minimum bounding box surrounding original starting points. "Conv.Hull": Trajectories placed within convex hull encompasses original starting points, providing precise representation area occupied tracks. "Custom": Allows users define specific region interest providing matrix coordinates (custom.coord) specifies vertices desired area. option particularly useful certain spatial features environmental conditions known constrain movement. choice origin.permutation reflect nature behavioral hypothesis tested. example, using "None" appropriate testing intersections compare scenarios trackmakers originate specific locations. contrast, options like "Min.Box", "Conv.Hull", "Custom" suitable evaluating intersections differ tracks originated broader predefined area. track_intersection() function also allows integration similarity metrics computed using simil_DTW_metric() simil_Frechet_metric(). combination intersection counts similarity metrics can provide comprehensive analysis trackmakers interacted, whether movements coordinated independent, whether interactions consistent hypothesized behavioral patterns. Overall, selection H1 origin.permutation carefully considered light specific hypotheses tested. combining intersection metrics similarity measures, users can obtain deeper understanding behavioral dynamics underlying observed trackways.

title: Calculate intersection metrics in tracks — track_intersection

title: Print track parameters — track_param
text: track_param() function compute print various parameters tracks list track data.

title: Print track parameters — track_param
code: track_param(data)

title: Print track parameters — track_param
text: data 'track' R object, list consisting two elements: Trajectories: list interpolated trajectories, trajectory series midpoints consecutive footprints. Footprints: list data frames containing footprint coordinates, metadata (e.g., image reference, ID), marker indicating whether footprint actual inferred.

title: Print track parameters — track_param
text: list lists, sublist contains computed parameters corresponding track. parameters included : Turning_angles: vector turning angles track (degrees). Mean_turning_angle: mean turning angles (degrees). Standard_deviation_turning_angle: standard deviation turning angles (degrees). Distance: total distance covered track (meters). Length: length track  (meters). Step_lengths: vector step lengths track  (meters). Mean_step_length: mean step lengths  (meters). Standard_deviation_step_length: standard deviation step lengths  (meters). Sinuosity: sinuosity track (dimensionless). Straightness: straightness track (dimensionless). reference direction, 0 degrees, considered along positive x-axis. means angles measured counterclockwise positive x-axis, 0 degrees (0 degrees) pointing directly along axis. detailed explanation appropriate methods analyzing circular data, refer Batschelet (1981). Sinuosity calculated according Benhamou (2004), defined equation 8. formula used refined version sinuosity index presented Bovet & Benhamou (1988), applicable broader range turning angle distributions require constant step length. sinuosity computed using formula: $$S = 2 \left[ p \left( \frac{1 + c}{1 - c} + b^2 \right) \right]^{-0.5}$$ : p mean step length (meters), c mean cosine turning angles (radians), b coefficient variation step length (meters). straightness index defined ratio D/L, : D beeline distance first last points trajectory (meters), L total path length traveled (meters). Straightness index based method described Batschelet (1981). According Benhamou (2004), straightness index serves reliable measure efficiency directed walk. However, suitable random trajectories, index random walk tends towards zero increasing steps. Thus, recommended use measure compare tortuosity random walks consist similar number steps.

title: Print track parameters — track_param
text: function calculates various movement parameters track provided data. uses following helper functions trajr (Animal Trajectory Analysis) package: TrajAngles(): Calculates turning angles track. TrajDistance(): Calculates total distance covered track. TrajLength(): Calculates length track. TrajStepLengths(): Calculates step lengths track. TrajSinuosity2(): Calculates sinuosity track. TrajStraightness(): Calculates straightness track.

title: Print track parameters — track_param
text: Batschelet, E. (1981). Circular statistics biology. Academic press, 111 Fifth Ave., New York, NY 10003, 1981, 388. Benhamou, S. (2004). reliably estimate tortuosity animal's path:: straightness, sinuosity, fractal dimension?. Journal theoretical biology, 229(2), 209-220. Bovet, P., & Benhamou, S. (1988). Spatial analysis animals' movements using correlated random walk model. Journal theoretical biology, 131(4), 419-433.

title: Print track parameters — track_param
text: Humberto G. Ferrón humberto.ferron@uv.es Macroevolution Functional Morphology Research Group (www.macrofun.es) Cavanilles Institute Biodiversity Evolutionary Biology Calle Catedrático José Beltrán Martínez, nº 2 46980 Paterna - Valencia - Spain Phone: +34 (9635) 44477

what: Calculate velocities and relative stride lengths for tracks — velocity_track
title: Calculate velocities and relative stride lengths for tracks — velocity_track
text: velocity_track() calculates velocities relative stride lengths step series tracks, based step length, height hip, gravity acceleration.

title: Calculate velocities and relative stride lengths for tracks — velocity_track
code: velocity_track(data, H, G = NULL, method = NULL)

title: Calculate velocities and relative stride lengths for tracks — velocity_track
text: data 'track' R object, list consisting two elements: Trajectories: list interpolated trajectories, trajectory series midpoints consecutive footprints. Footprints: list data frames containing footprint coordinates, metadata (e.g., image reference, ID), marker indicating whether footprint actual inferred. H numeric vector representing height hip (meters) track maker. length vector match number tracks data. G Gravity acceleration (meters per second squared). Default 9.8. method character vector specifying method calculate velocities track. Method "" follows approach Alexander (1976), method "B" based Ruiz & Torices (2013). NULL, method "" used tracks.

title: Calculate velocities and relative stride lengths for tracks — velocity_track
text: 'track velocity' R object consisting list lists, sublist contains computed parameters corresponding track. parameters included : Step_velocities: vector velocities step track (meters per second). Mean_velocity: mean velocity across steps track (meters per second). Standard_deviation_velocity: standard deviation velocities across steps track (meters per second). Maximum_velocity: maximum velocity among steps track (meters per second). Minimum_velocity: minimum velocity among steps track (meters per second). Step_relative_stride: vector relative stride lengths step track (dimensionless). Mean_relative_stride: mean relative stride length across steps track (dimensionless). Standard_deviation_relative_stride: standard deviation relative stride lengths across steps track (dimensionless). Maximum_relative_stride: maximum relative stride length among steps track (dimensionless). Minimum_relative_stride: minimum relative stride length among steps track (dimensionless).

title: Calculate velocities and relative stride lengths for tracks — velocity_track
text: velocity_track() function calculates velocities using two methods: Method : Based Alexander (1976), formula: $$v = 0.25 \cdot \sqrt{G} \cdot S^{1.67} \cdot H^{-1.17}$$ v: Velocity track-maker (meters per second). G: Acceleration due gravity (meters per second squared), typically \(9.81\ \text{m/s}^2\). S: Stride length, distance consecutive footprints (meters). H: Height hip track-maker (meters). coefficients \(0.25\), \(1.67\), \(-1.17\) derived empirical studies. coefficients adjust formula account different animal sizes gaits. method applies wide range terrestrial vertebrates used estimate velocity across different gaits. Method B: Based Ruiz & Torices (2013), formula: $$v = 0.226 \cdot \sqrt{G} \cdot S^{1.67} \cdot H^{-1.17}$$ v: Velocity track-maker (meters per second). G: Acceleration due gravity (meters per second squared), typically \(9.81\ \text{m/s}^2\). S: Stride length (meters). H: Height hip track-maker (meters). oefficient \(0.226\) method B refinement based updated data bipedal locomotion. Based Thulborn & Wade (1984), possible identify gaits track-makers basis relative stride length, follows: Walk: \(/H < 2.0\); locomotor performance equivalent walking mammals. Trot: \(2.0 \leq /H \leq 2.9\); locomotor performance equivalent trotting racking mammals. Run: \(/H > 2.9\); locomotor performance equivalent cantering, galloping, sprinting mammals.

title: Calculate velocities and relative stride lengths for tracks — velocity_track
text: Alexander, R. M. (1976). Estimates speeds dinosaurs. Nature, 261(5556), 129-130. Ruiz, J., & Torices, . (2013). Humans running stadiums beaches accuracy speed estimations fossil trackways. Ichnos, 20(1), 31-35. Thulborn, R. ., & Wade, M. (1984). Dinosaur trackways Winton Formation (mid-Cretaceous) Queensland. Memoirs Queensland Museum, 21(2), 413-517.
